channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: CCPD Virtual Summer Series to Conclude with Velan Studios Info Session
item.description: From 6:30PM to 7:30PM on Thursday, August 1, the team at Velan Studios will discuss the organization’s career paths and company culture, as well as upcoming opportunities for Arch students seeking an Away experience. Students can also review the Spring 2025 Programmer Internship opportunity posted in Handshake.
item.author: Students

item.title: Class of 2026 Lake George Trip Scheduled for August 3
item.description: Date: Saturday, August 3, 2024 11:00 AM - 7:00 PM - The Class of 2026 Council and The Arch Ambassadors invite current Summer Arch students to join them for a day trip to explore the iconic upstate New York village of Lake George. Registration is required and space is limited, so register now!
item.author: Students

item.title: Don’t Forget This Week’s Center of Gravity!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 31, 2024 4:00 PM - 10:00 PM - The Center of Gravity is your one-stop for personal, academic and well-being success this summer! Activities include novelty food and snacks, academic support from peer tutors and course TAs, away semester searches with the CCPD, wellness and well-being activities, water coloring, Legos, book clubs and more, so be sure to visit weekly!
item.author: Community

item.title: Summer Undergraduate Research Fair Scheduled for July 31
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 31, 2024 3:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Please join event sponsors the School of Science and the Arch for this year’s summer Undergraduate Research Fair, a campus-wide recognition of undergraduate research that gives the campus community a chance to support our students and engage in their innovative work. Light refreshments will be provided.
item.author: Community

item.title: Earth’s Disastrous 10th Tipping Point Has Been Identified
item.description: Crossing Planetary Boundaries, a concept that defines nine potential ecological “tipping points,” could spell doom for ecosystems and humanity’s future on the planet. Humans have already crossed six of these nine thresholds, and scientists now argue there’s potentially a tenth boundary that’s gone unrecognized regarding worldwide aquatic deoxygenation in bodies of water. Rensselaer professor Kevin Rose, the lead author on the study, lends his comments in this MSN article.
item.author: Community

item.title: How to manage moving stress: Advice from experts
item.description: Jose Holquin-Veras, William H. Hart chair, professor and director at Rensselaer’s Center for Infrastructure, Transportation and the Environment, offers comments in this article, which appeared in the July 20 online edition of USA Today.
item.author: Community

item.title: TIAA Offering Confidential In-Person Retirement Counseling August 14
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, August 14, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
